Likelihood named distributions model

Source: vignettes/likelihood-name.Rmd
likelihood-name.Rmd

Installation

You can install the development version of likelihood.model from GitHub with:

#> Loading required package: devtools
#> Loading required package: usethis
#> Loading required package: algebraic.mle
#> Registered S3 method overwritten by 'algebraic.dist':
#>   method     from 
#>   print.dist stats
#> Loading required package: likelihood.model

Introduction 

model <- likelihood_name("norm", "x", "censoring")
print(model)
#> $dist_name
#> [1] "norm"
#> 
#> $pdf
#> function (x, mean = 0, sd = 1, log = FALSE) 
#> .Call(C_dnorm, x, mean, sd, log)
#> <bytecode: 0x55c1a8f8d830>
#> <environment: namespace:stats>
#> 
#> $cdf
#> function (q, mean = 0, sd = 1, lower.tail = TRUE, log.p = FALSE) 
#> .Call(C_pnorm, q, mean, sd, lower.tail, log.p)
#> <bytecode: 0x55c1a8f93040>
#> <environment: namespace:stats>
#> 
#> $ob_col
#> [1] "x"
#> 
#> $censor_col
#> [1] "censoring"
#> 
#> attr(,"class")
#> [1] "likelihood_name_norm"  "likelihood_name_model" "likelihood_model"
print(class(model))
#> [1] "likelihood_name_norm"  "likelihood_name_model" "likelihood_model"
print(assumptions(model))
#> [1] "independent"                          
#> [2] "identically distributed"              
#> [3] "norm distribution"                    
#> [4] "censoring independent of observations"
#> [5] "censoring independent of parameters"
n <- 150
set.seed(1235)

df <- data.frame(
  x = rnorm(n, mean = 0, sd = 1),
  censoring = rep("exact", n)
)

head(df)
#>       x censoring
#> 1 -0.70     exact
#> 2 -1.28     exact
#> 3  0.99     exact
#> 4  0.11     exact
#> 5  0.11     exact
#> 6  1.70     exact
ll <- loglik(model)
ll(df, c(0, 1))
#> [1] -227
s <- score(model)
print(s)
#> function (df, par, ...) 
#> {
#>     stopifnot(!is.null(df), !is.null(par))
#>     grad(func = ll, x = par, method = control$method, side = control$side, 
#>         method.args = control$method.args, df = df, ...)
#> }
#> <bytecode: 0x55c1af0cba90>
#> <environment: 0x55c1af0cad00>
#print(s(df, c(0, 1)))
#H <- hess_loglik(model)
#print(H)
#print(H(df, c(0, 1)))
